title: Azir Buff Idea- Remove the Duration of His Passive Turret
body:
Why must Shurima fall once again? WE MUST EXPAND ONWARDS! WE SHALL RECLAIM OUR KINGDOM AND BUILD OUR ARMY!

(Ok, but seriously, why does the health have to decay until it decays itself to death? It already loses all of it's armor if Azir isn't nearby, why the double defense nerf?)

> **CHANGES**

> **Passive- Shurima's Legacy**
- No longer loses health if Azir is within 2500 units of the tower
NOTE: Only one tower can be created at once
- Sand Tower now begins to regenerate 1% of it's max health every second after being out of combat for 10 seconds (only when Azir is nearby)

EDIT: Instead of always permanent, it now doesn't lose health if Azir is within 2500 units of it.

replies.body: Non decaying passive towers are something we've tried, both during Azir's original development and again during the 6.24 development cycle. In some cases it's a fine change, and one that certainly feels better to Azir. In other cases though it leads to Azir stalling a lane out or keeping perpetual pressure if his team's the one sieging. Decaying health's a safety valve as a result, allowing teams to mix waiting the tower out and putting damage on it as responses.

It is a good safety valve yes, but in my opinion it might not be the best way for the tower to have a duration if it has any. An idea that could be tried is making his passive tower drain a portion of it's life every time it fires a bullet (like 3% or so per attack, would require fine tuning) so the tower does gradually kill itself, but only when it is in use and being assaulted. Just having it passively kill itself off encourages the opponent more to just roam elsewhere momentarily (especially with the gold reward changes) since they know it's only a temporary obstacle that will die off in a minute. The only time the current tower is a real threat or even decent obstacle is if it is spawned in the middle of a team fight, upon which there really isn't any difference between it and a Heimerdinger turret other than being restricted to where a turret has died.
This is especially true in your own base for defending objectives since Azir's turret itself doesn't prevent damage to structures behind it last time I checked.

What about something halfway?

Say the closer he builds the turret to his nexus, the better the turrets are. On an enemy inner turret, it would degrade even faster than what we have now. However, this gets better and better, until you finally reach the inhib towers, where they won't degrade at all, or just very slowly. You could also possibly add in an interesting buff to his towers if built on a nexus tower, since they are the closest to his nexus, like increased damage or fire rate. 

I offer this idea because in several other games where turrets are used (i.e. Overwatch), the character using them is predominantly defensive. Sure, they have offensive uses, but they really shine in defense.

In my opinion, this could give Azir an interesting niche, and possibly even tie in well with him being an Emperor. The closer you get to his home, the better he can defend it.

Decaying health's a safety valve as a result, allowing teams to mix waiting the tower out and putting damage on it as responses.

What if Azir needed to be near his tower, as in the tower would decay much faster than it did now if Azir did not remain within range? Would tethering the tower's usefulness to Azir's presence be more impactful when he's trying to hold a position, but also eliminate the scenario where Azir can create a turret for his team to fall behind if they're getting rushed/need to retreat? 

As a trade-off to this power, wouldn't it make sense to limit him to a stationary role when he's using it? Just trying to spitball ideas here since Azir's been on the backburner for a long time, and the core idea behind his design was for him to be a zone-control mage, with the turret being one the strongest form of zone control in the game.

On another topic; has the team looked into removing Azir's Q's damage in favour of gearing it towards more of a re-positioning tool so that Azir's DPS is more closely related to how effectively he can use his soldier's AAs? A bit problem that has been expressed by both Riot and players is how effectively he's able to burst opponents from a quick Q -> AA, AA. With Rylais becoming considerably less effective on the Emperor, might it be a good opportunity to shift more power from the Q into the W to make his pattern more counter-playable?

As an aside, this would also make him more distinct from Orianna who relies on passing the ball through enemies to deal damage - whereas he would rely on hitting as many AAs as possible to maximize his output.

I wonder about tying the strength of the tower in relation to Azir's allies, himself, and the such. An unattended tower is much weaker than one 5 people are huddling under for the glorious golden radiance, for example.
I'd personally rather you guys focus on looking at Azir himself, and the changes you feel you need to make to get him to a more healthy spot etc

I think this would be rather problematic for teams that are behind. I'd rather see either one lane w/ the turret that doesn't die, or turrets that don't lose health overtime and instead just die when the cool down runs out.
